bibl.title: A pearl of great price? (P.Mich. inv. 4086)
bibl.seg: Kyle Helms & Michael Zellmann-Rohrer, A Pearl of Great Price? (P.Mich. inv. 4086).
Provenance unknown, VI CE. The text provides a glimpse of a sixth-century epistolary network that connects commerce along the Nile, likely including the pearl trade, with Constantinople.
bibl.note: Provenance unknown, VI CE. The text provides a glimpse of a sixth-century epistolary network that connects commerce along the Nile, likely including the pearl trade, with Constantinople.
